report.summary: Files like File_conflict_TIMESTAMP.txt when editing files on the Android device (Jota Text Editor)
report.label: None yet
report.description: While testing the behaviour of down- and uploads with a single file File.txt for editing, I now noticed a spooky file File_conflict_20121030_084503.txt on the Android. I use server 4.5.1a Android 1.3.14 Jota Text Editor (Android) with enabled setting to use abackup version when editing. This editor creates a backup file with filename File.txt~ . Perhaps this backup file (renaming, swapping names of current and backup version ???) is causing the reported issue. In previous tests I disabled the backup file creation in the Jota Text Editor settings and everything (editing on the server, editing in Windows client and editing on the Android device) appeared to work fine, at least I did not notice problems when synchronising the Android client manually - for this see bartoszprzybylski/owncloud-android#43 ) The Delete button however only offers to the delete this particular file on the server(!). The Windows client does not show such a file in the file list. Questions: Please can you explain why the Android client offers "delete on the server" ? Should the text become "delete locally" because there is no File_conflict_TIMESTAMP.txt on the server but a conflicting backup file File.txt~ locally ? [UPDATE] I think I was wrong. The file is indeed on the server. This exact local file name (File.txt~) should be listed locally in the Android client, or File.txt~___conflict_TIMESTAMP [UPDATE] I think I was wrong. The file is indeed on the server.

report.summary: OC-Application "Store"
report.label: None yet
report.description: There are several Android devices in the family. Somtimes the mobil devices are refreshed, damaged or handed to someone else in the family. Every time the privat information should be cleared, in most cases the Apps are also cleared. So the need to buy apps multiple times over time is evident. To ease and overcome this, I invision to have an app repository in my OC, where all the apps that where bought are residing. Actually the idea is, that there could be a OC-app serving as "buying agent", that buying agent "installs" the apps into that repository for further use (not as an app that runs in the OC rather an app that will be available for redistribution to be installed on multiple devices, Than another service app in the OC would act as a "market place" that can be accessed by all mobil devices. All devices/users with access to the privat OC-bought apps repository, should be able to access the app market (kind of an internal store, where my Mobil devices could install all apps from this "internal store" - to the device. This is kind of a apps archive and "redistribution" idea for apps in my home mobil device infrastructure.

report.summary: Poor performance on large file trees
report.label: None yet
report.description: The OwnCloud Android app performs pretty poor on large file trees. FileListListAdapter traverses recursively through all subfolders get the file size of a directory while filling a view in getView(). This results in large database interactions in performance critical sections of the application. There are two possible solutions to this issue: calculate file size of directories on an own Thread. calculate file size of directories while syncing and safe directory size to the database. the latter one should be preferred as it doesn't fuck up the adapter and won't fill up the CPU/RAM/Stack

report.summary: wish: possibility to sync folders outside of /owncloud/*
report.label: None yet
report.description: I really much miss the possibility to so select a folder for syncing on Android which is outside the /owncloud-folder. At the moment I still have to use Dropbox for making backups/syncing of appdata (like e.g. Titanium Backup). Many apps have Dropbox implemented which makes it easy to use. But since they are basically just uploading a file/folder, it would be very easy to replace this function by Owncloud, if the Owncloud-syncclient for Android would able to select the folder the data is stored on the phone.

report.summary: App unusably slow / Unjustified "Invalid credentials" after reinstall
report.label: None yet
report.description: Expected behaviour App to react in a quick fashion, especially when in the same network as the server, with full WiFi reception. Actual behaviour The app is running unusably slow at the moment. Just when I start it, it takes about half a minute before it shows any folder listing, before it just shows the title bar and white for the rest of the screen. Then when it finally shows the file list, every action (clicking on any folder, clicking the back button, or even just clicking on the settings button or trying to save them) sometimes (every second time or so) takes about 10 seconds... frequently also the popup "App is not reacting. Do you want to close it?" pops up. I have no files which I keep "up to date", the synchronisation in the account is disabled, I mainly use ownCloud on the android to access one file, which I infrequently manually download; I do have "Instant Upload" enabled (but that doesn't seem to be fully working either, it doesn't upload all my images, only some of them, but that's another story). When I'm saying the app is slow, I mean there is no feedback whatsoever if the app is still doing something (let alone what it is doing), the user interface is just stuck; when coming back from settings it sometimes just turns black for a few seconds... When coming back from the lock screen, I can't even scroll in the file list, I have to wait for a few seconds... Any more information I could provide to help resolve this? The GN shouldn't be that out of date for the app to run so slow? What could cause this? From my momentary perspective also the battery seems to drain quite fast when the app is running... Edit: Clearing the App's data didn't change anything. Will try reinstalling next, just to be sure. Edit 2: Great: After a re-install, it doesn't seem to be able to connect to the account again. It always (first time with the still existing account data, and two more times with the (definitely correctly) entered password) says "invalid credentials". Edit 3: Removed and recreated the account, restarted the phone, re-tried entering the password several times, but now still just getting an unjustified "Invalid credentials" (the provided credentials are definitely correct). I guess this is basically the worst-case-scenario - going from unusably slow to not usable at all... Any hints what I could try? I've exhausted all usual methods of resolving Android app problems I could think of! Environment data Android version: 4.2.2 Device model: Galaxy Nexus Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 1.4.1 ownCloud server version: 5.0.7 Logs Web server error log no relevant entries ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) no relevant entries

report.label: None yet
report.description: Consider the following use case: I use my device as an offline reader for PDFs that I find throughout the day on my desktop. When I find a document that I want to read later, I copy it to an ownCloud-shared folder. When I get to my Android device, I want all files collected during the day to be available on it, even in offline mode. Currently I have to perform the following tiresome sequence on the device: Press "Update" and wait until finishes Open the folder used to store new documents Click on each of the documents so that it gets downloaded and opened in a PDF viewer Close the viewer and proceed to the next file. When there are more than a couple of new files this sequence becomes a really boring thing to do. What I want to suggest is that certain folders can be marked as auto-update, just like it can be done for individual files today. The above scenario becomes much more simple: 0. Mark a folder as "auto-update" (once) Press "Update" and wait until all new files are downloaded to the device.

report.summary: Client does not always upload pdf files upon modification
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am using the android client (v.1.5.8 from f-droid) on a Samsung Note 8 (android v. 4.2.2) and I am trying to keep some pdf files in sync. I expect files to automatically syncronize to the server after I add annotations or highlights, i.e. files should be uploaded soon after they are modified. However, this does not happen, not even if I force a sync tapping on "Refresh account". When I check the modification time of the pdfs using a file browser, I can see the modification time is older than the one shown in the client. The only workaround I found is (1) to manually force a sync by long tapping the file and then choosing "Refresh file" or (2) to force the sync of another file in the same folder as in (1), then the other files are uploaded after I modified them (this seems to work consistently, at least as far as I could test) I don't have similar problems with other types of files, for instance text files are uploaded immediately after modification. Also there is nothing suspicious in owncloud.log on the server.

report.summary: What could be improved or added as a new feature to make Android client better?
report.label: None yet
report.description: This issue is meant to discuss improvements in the Android Client. I posted a workaround before, little bit like a wake up call to that many users request one thing, but nothing happens. This is purely a discussion, and nothing else. It´s not personal against anyone either. I just want to make it clear what is missing, and what would improve the client - a lot. PR´s are more than welcome. As I see it today we are missing or could improve: Photos and videos gets downloaded and is stored both in the regular photos folder of the phone in DCIM, and also by ownCloud client in "Misc". #588 #592 #640 #601 #346 #156 #375 When a photo or video is taken and fails, it should retry again. #340 #646 Add a delay for Instant Uploads so you have time to delete the photos you don´t want before they get uploaded to the server. #643 A "smart upload" that get´s information from server and don´t upload it if there already is a copy, or upload it once more and overwrite the old file, or make a new copy, and only one copy in that case. #554 Only upload when phone is charging. #465 Two-way sync. #3 Browse the pictures without downloading them, instead - get the information from the server directly. #588 Delete the picture from phone (DCIM folder) after it have successfully been uploaded. #588 This is what my workaround fixes. But it should not have to be a workaround, it should be native, in the original ownCloud app. New suggestions: Download a folder - this is quite nice as people might have 100 mp3s in one folder for example. (Thanks @wakeup) ______________ Questions to begin with: Why haven´t this been prioritized before? What obstacles is present to make this happen? Why is this bad ideas design-wise? Why is so many users not being listened to? My intentions are good, and have always been. I spend 95% of my free time on/with ownCloud, of course I want to make it better but right now it feels like there are many different ways to deal (or not deal) with these issues. Could we please talk it through? CCing all that could be interested in this: @jancborchardt @davivel @lukeowncloud @stefan-niedermann @tobiasKaminsky @owncloud/designers

report.summary: Drop movie and audio player. Focus on important matters.
report.label: None yet
report.description: Why does owncloud app come with a media player for audio and video? It would make sense if media was streamed. But currently it is downloaded and then played. These files can be played with any player, cf. #775 Making a good movie player is out of scope for the owncloud app which is supposed to sync files. Currently the movie player does not work well: Movie starts over when turning device, when clicking on movie error is shown and movie stops, white background is annoying, no full screen, ... I propose to drop the movie player (which is the same as the audio player?).

report.summary: Endless loading after deleting old OC account and adding new one
report.label: None yet
report.description: I copied the content of one OC server to another. The desktop sync client works with the new OC server. But after deleting the old OC account from OwnCloud App (1.6.2) and adding the new one, I am now stuck in an endless loading loop (for about 2 hrs now). Although there were some connections to the server at the beginning of that loading loop, there is now no opened connection to the server. Reinstallation of the app, deleting app cache as well as owncloud folders on sd card did not help. Now when I delete that new account and add an account for the old OC server (which worked before), it also seems to endlessly load. The OC server is running stable version 7.0.3. It contains about 9800 files with a size of around 16 GB in that specific account. There are no specific errors or warnings logged on the server. EDIT: Just tested with an empty test account and it's the same.

report.summary: Android-client wastes insane amounts of bandwidth and time
report.label: None yet
report.description: On Android if I have background data sync enabled for ownCloud it periodically starts a scan to refresh stats on files, but it goes through every file, not just those that have been tagged in the client as ones that should be kept up-to-date. In addition to this, it insists on querying every single god damn file and folder individually, using enormous amounts of data. Since I have thousands of files on my ownCloud-account this takes a long, long time, it keeps the connection open for hours and it consumes several megabytes every single refresh. It should obviously only refresh stats on the files that have been tagged, and even then, it should just send a single request to the server with all the files listed that it wants stats on and the server should just reply with a single response similarly with all the stats for the requested files.

report.summary: Feature request: Sort files by on-device-status
report.label: None yet
report.description: This kind of a follow-up on #639: I have some folders on my owncloud that contain a bunch (>100) media files. Some (far less than 50 %) of them are also downloaded to my mobile phone. In some situations where I don't have any or not sufficient internet connectivity or don't want to waste data volume but want to watch a video or listen to some audio file I browse through those folders on my device to find something suitable. At the moment, I have to scroll through the file list and keep track of the small green arrows that indicate that the file was downloaded. As I can only access the files on the device in that situation, it would be convenient if I could just sort the files by their status, i.e. files that are stored on the device before those that aren't and therefore have all the available files in one bunch.

report.summary: add menu entry for global upload of modified files
report.label: None yet
report.description: In my issue report #876, I reported a bad behaviour of the client. I mentioned a "second step" as a work-around for this. The current implementation of the client if more file oriented. I have to download single files, mark singles files to stay in sync und upload single files is modified. To make ths a little bit more handy, the client should allow the upload of all modified files within a directory (from it's global menu). It isn't funny to manually sync / upload a couple of files by opening the context menu of each modified file. ;-) IMO it is worth thinking about an configuration option, where the user is able to choose between "manually upload modified files", or "automatically upload local changes".

report.summary: Federated Authentication error: "Cannot authenticate against this server"
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I'm trying to access a OC server through a federated infrastructure. When trying to connect to a server at the following address: https://cana.imd.ufrn.br/oc-shib I get the following error message of the app: "Cannot authenticate against this server" Accessing through a browser is all normal. As well as in the desktop client that shows the page to choose the Idp and , since the IDP is selected, your login page appears , once authenticated I have access to my files. The problem is access through the android client. Analyzing the source code, I note that The mAuthTokenType variable in AuthenticatorActivity class is definied for "owncloud.password", but the authentication method identified is SAML_WEB_SSO. So the authSupported method (in line 1065) returns false, generating the message "auth_can_not_auth_against_server". On the other hand. When the auth_method_saml_web_sso(in steup.xml) is definied to "on", the mAuthTokenType value is definied to "owncloud.saml.web_sso.session_cookie". Thus the app shows only the server url field, and when I input the url, a webView dialog is shown, loading the page to the IDP choosing page. But when I interact with it, it crashes and the application returns to the initial screen. Apparently the value of mAuthTokenType is definied during startup(line 219) and is no longer modified. Even when the authentication method identified is the SAML_WEB_SSO. Why is this happening? federated authentication is actually supported by app? Any help would be much appreciated. Thank you.

Makes the owncloud app nearly useless for me at the moment because I can't trust that everything is just working.

report.summary: No error messages when there are problems in the network connection
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently owncloud for android does a TERRIBLE job showing what is happening when there are problems with the network connection. I will show two examples: Right now i "appear" to be connected to my 3g network, but somehow cant connect to anything. If i open owncloud app, and try to refresh some file ( which i have sure it was modified on the server) owncloud will popup a progressbar with "Wait a moment" and a few seconds later the progress will disappear and nothing is done, the file is not downloaded, there are no error messages , just nothing. Even worse, if i try to enter any folder in this condition, i will get : "nothing uploaded here" which is clearly wrong !

report.summary: File sorting on upload
report.label: None yet
report.description: It would be great if we could sort files in any way, when searching for upload them (from the ownCloud app), at least like usual folder browsing inside the app.

report.summary: Owncloud app should accept as many share content as possible
report.label: None yet
report.description: The owncloud app is listed among the apps to share information whenever you choice to share something. However, most of the time the share fails, since the owncloud app does not know how to handle the data. This is really frustrating. The most advantage purpose of having access to the owncloud server on an android device is the point that one is able to add very quickly content.. Owncloud on the go... The Owncloud app should therefore try to handle as much shared data as possible. If there are multiple ways, it could offer a selection. E.g. saving as txt or odt. Furthermore, the settings could define standard saving options. E.g. Save in the folder notes/income/ save as $date-time-app-name. It should be possible to save text, images, videos, links, html, etc. An example how such a saving method could work would be the save dialogs of the firefox webbrowser, where one can simply save as default by a single click or allow customized saving settings.

report.summary: Contacts and Calender syncing In-App
report.label: None yet
report.description: This would be a great feature - Syncing the local Calender/Contacts with your OwnCloud account if the app is enabled on the server. This would be a great because I'm sure other people, and not just my self, don't like the idea of downloading third-party applications and would rather prefer an original app from OwnCloud for dealing with sensitive information like this. I know Google use multiple applications, so I'm sure someone will come up with an idea whether to either have an application that does everything (aka OwnCloud), or split it into different apps from OwnCloud, e.g OwnCloud Contacts, OwnCloud Calender, etc.

report.summary: Disable File System Access in Webview Activity
report.label: None yet
report.description: If an attacker somehow find themselves in a position to inject script into a WebView, then they could exploit the opportunity to access local resources. This can be somewhat prevented by disabling local file system access. It is enabled by default. The Android WebSettings class can be used to disable local file system access via the public method setAllowFileAccess. webSettings().setAllowFileAccess(false); This restricts the WebView to loading local resources from file:///android_asset (assets) and file:///android_res (resources).

report.summary: Security
report.label: None yet
report.description: For security, I think 2FA is a must, TOTP should be sufficient. So that a compromised password isn't too big of an issue. Also, would it be possible for the Android and Desktop clients to check the SSL certificate fingerprint? Bassically, in the settings menu it should have a little information about the SSL certificate including the fingerprint. The app should give a warning when anything changed, that way MIT attacks are nearly impossible.

report.summary: Public Beta
report.label: None yet
report.description: In order to pre-test the PRs by the community I suggest to create a public beta in a new branch. There will be an apk, that experienced user can download, install and test. This branch will contains all PRs that are "3 - to review" or above. Issues regarding the beta will get the label "Beta". Found bugs or improvements are implemented in the corresponding original PRs and merged back to beta. The main advantage of this is, that the PRs are tested by far more user than "only" the QA. Furthermore if the PRs have fewer issues, the workload of the QA should be lower and thus can result in a faster merge process. I am willing to maintain this branch and do a merge if the belonging PRs are changing. What do you think? @davivel @rperezb @jancborchardt @AndyScherzinger @lukeowncloud

report.summary: Beta: 2015-11-05 Suggestion: Make the list / grid view a simple toggle
report.label: None yet
report.description: I was very happy when You introduced the possibility of using the grid view for all folders as I have many forlders with both documents and pictures or scans. Sometimes I do switch between the views as both have its advantages. When I was using the beta now, I found out that it is a little schizofrenic when EACH folder remembers the last viewing method. Several times I switched to grid view to look for some picture quickly, and I went through several subdirectories. Later I was viewing some of the diretories in list view. After some time I ended up with directories (seemingly) randomly switching between grid and list views as I was going through them. It was kind of.. odd behaviour. I think it would be better to have the grid/list as a mode switch like in other file managers. (When You use Nautilus or anything else, Your view also doesn’t switch from icon to list view as You go through the directory tree). Do You agree with me or do You have a different reason to have the view remembered for each folder?

report.summary: Implement a Document Provider
report.label: None yet
report.description: One sorely lacking feature (unless it's already implemented in which case this is a bug report) is the lack of ownCloud's app acting as a document provider. A document provider essentially tells the Android operating system that it is an application that manages files. Google Drive is a document provider, and therefore whenever the OS-level file picker comes up (for example, when selecting a new image as a wallpaper), Google Drive is offered as one such service you can use to browse files. Implementing this feature shouldn't be too terrible hard, all the documentation on it is provided here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider.html

report.summary: View Photos Temporarily without Downloading them to System
report.label: None yet
report.description: One personal annoyance is that the ownCloud app downloads every image that I open on my devices to the internal storage. Sometimes, I want to view an image just temporarily and NOT have it automatically downloaded and stored to /sdcard/owncloud/.../. Perhaps downloading them into a cache would be more proper, then if the user clicks the menu button, offer to let them download the image and then it would be appropriate to save it to /sdcard/owncloud/.../. Otherwise every image I view from a different folder (and I have many, many folders) from the ownCloud app triggers Google Play Services to shoot me a notification asking if I want to backup that folder to Google Photos.

report.summary: Client keeps scanning directory even though it should not be synched
report.label: None yet
report.description: Expected behaviour it should be possible to not autosynch/refresh specific folders. Actual behaviour the client is relentless and goes on for hours, synching scanning a folder that was removed locally, until the phone runs out of battery. i have a directory in my owncloud storage that i do not want to synch on my phone as it's rather big (~2GB). what i've done so far is select the directory in the client, select 'remove' and then 'local copy only'. i'm not sure if this is supposed to disable the synching of this directory from that point on, but as i see no other setting where i can exempt this folder, i guess it should. Steps to reproduce have a rather big folder in your owncloud (~2gb in my case) wait. Environment data Android version: 5.1 Device model: Moto G LTE 1st gen Stock or customized system: stock ownCloud app version: 1.9.0 ownCloud server version: 8.1.2 Logs Web server error log this goes on for hours: PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/that_folder/[...] ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) there are no entries from the time the issue occured.

report.summary: Synchronization has to be performed manually
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi ! When using the Android OwnCloud client, I have to manually select a file and click on "synchronize" otherwise, its content is not updated -- although the file properties are correctly updated in the Owncloud client. STEPS TO PERFORM perform the initial synchronization for instance I have a file called todo.txt in Documents/ which is properly synced I make a modification on my desktop client (KDE under Kubuntu). I make sure this is properly uploaded to the server : this is OK (checked from web interface) the file is not synced on the Android device I check the Owncloud client on the Android device : I can see the new filesize and new file date is displayed but when I click on the file, I can still see its former content the only way to make the OC Android client sync it properly is to select "synchronize" in the file context menu The problem is it has to be done manually each time. This is misleading as files attributes, in the OC client, are the right ones but the file content is not updated. Using : Server : Owncloud 8.1 (web4all.fr hosting) Desktop client : Kubuntu 14.04 LTS + Owncloud client v.2.1 Android Phone : Samsung Galaxy Core Prime LTE ; Android 5.0.2 Android Owncloud client : 1.9.0 Thanks to everyone involved ! Cheers !

report.summary: Can't upload videos to OC from mobile
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I'm newbie in OC, but I'm stuck and cannot find any solution. I'm running OC8.2 on headless Debian Server (Trusty) with MySQL. I am running OwnClient Android appli on Android 5.0.2/Samsung S5: I have Instant video upload and Inst enabled on Android App, with upload via Wifi only Here is description of the issue and outcome of my investigations: If I'm connected on my Wifi home network with my mobile and I record a video, the video is immediately uploaded to OC. Additinal information :idea: : I have also changed the OC folder for video upload several time (I have initially suspected that using same folder for images and videos could cause troubles), but it does not change anything. when a video is uploaded successfully (when I'm at home, recording and connected), I get the following error in the logs: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58 Your help will be appreciated. report.summary: Need to view from server without downloading
report.label: None yet
report.description: Let's say I upload some images from my Android phone's photo gallery into a folder called "Uploads" on my ownCloud server. When I use the ownCloud app to view the Uploads folder, if I tap an image that I want to see, it gets automatically downloaded to my phone and put in a new folder named Uploads. Great... If I view 100 photos now I have 100 duplicate images on my phone wasting space. Seems to me the act of downloading and saving, as opposed to simply viewing the image on the server, should be an optional selection. For example long press on the image and choose Download from a popup menu.

report.summary: Create a ThumbImageView
report.label: None yet
report.description: Thumbnails of images are currently shown in 3 different places. The uploadlist, the local file browser and the normal folder view of an nextcloud folder. The code to generate a thumbnail / kickof the thumbnail generation is present in all of there places. To unify this, i would like to propose a ThumbImageView class which subclases ImageView. This Class should handle all concern regarding File or OCFile -> Thumbnail, by calling ThumbManager and so on. The ImageView objects are reused in the list views, all code accesing these Views has to check whether the reference they use, still refer to a View with the initial File, this could be solved by having a Reference to OCFile or File on the ThumbImageView aswell as the unique thumbnail CacheKey! So we have some new methods like void setFile(File file); void setOCFile(OCFile file); int getCacheKey(); (maybe override .hashCode(), but this could be problematic with OCFiles not existing) Another possibility would be to introduce two additional classes FileThumbImageView and OCFileThumbImageView.. As far as i understand it, the Upload Queue and local filebrowser lists use File and the nextcloud folder browser uses OCFile.. This should only a refactor not any addition of new functionality.

report.summary: [UX] Main/settings menu only accessible from root folder
report.label: None yet
report.description: Steps Navigate into a deep folder From another app, upload some stuff using the "share" feature and picking ownCloud Wait for upload to finish and all notifications to disappear Now I want to go have a look at the upload list Expected When inside a deep folder, I'd like to have a way to go to the main menu. Actual No way to go to the main menu directly. Need to click the "Back" button on the top left of the mobile app until I reach the root folder. Only then can I access the upload list. I'm not familiar with the regular Android app design, maybe the current approach is an existing and acceptable design pattern. Now you might say that it's not a common use case to want to access the finished upload list and that it's ok to have that menu item there. To be discussed. @davivel @owncloud/design

report.summary: Trash icon too close to "three dots" menu
report.label: None yet
report.description: Note: I usually use vimtouch to open text files Install vimtouch (or any other text editor) Upload some text file "test.txt" from another machine In the ownCloud app, navigate into the folder of the file "test.txt" Hold on the "test.txt" item (we want to edit but don't want to view the file with the built-in viewer) Use the "three dots" menu to select "open with" but be clumsy and tap a bit on the left of it Expected No trash icon so close to "three dots" Actual Risk of tapping the delete icon when aiming for the three dots menu. Note: in general I'm not too happy to have to use this menu when editing a file. But due to the new built-in viewer I need to do more manual action to be able to open the file in an external editor. (maybe I'll make another separate report)

report.summary: SSL initialization failed
report.label: None yet
report.description: Actual behaviour Working with the Owncloud app stops working suddenly, now I get the error "SSL initialization failed". I tried to delete my account in the app, now I'm not able to reconnect to my ouwncloud server with the same error: "SSL initialization failed". The problem came up after an update of the phone's OS (at least I think so). The device is a Blackberry Z10 which is able to run Android apps since there is an special Android layer within the OS called Android Player. Using the web interface of the owncloud server from within the browser on the phone works. I'm pretty sure the problem lies in the server's SSL configuration. But I'm not able to find the cause resp. to adjust the settings. And I haven't access to all config data since it is a shared server. Test on https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/ gives A+ Expected behaviour Of course I would like to connect to the server using the app. Steps to reproduce In the app try to add a new account Type in the server address: https://.... The connection will be tested and the tests ends with the mentioned error message Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) No, I'm not able to reproduce the problem with demo.owncloud.org. It works fine. report.summary: General project structure
report.label: None yet
report.description: I see this in build.gradle This project was started in Eclipse and later moved to Android Studio. In the transition, both IDEs were supported. Due to this, the files layout is not the usual in new projects created with Android Studio / gradle. This file merges declarations usually split in two separates build.gradle file, one for global settings of the project in its root folder, another one for the app module in subfolder of root. Guys, Eclipse and Android are no team any more, and this makes no sense since 2015 ! I would like to make an PR to change project structure with an app directory, like most Android apps are, but when I see how much open PR's are there I see no chance doing this. Am I right ?

report.summary: Researching Build Breakage
report.label: None yet
report.description: Dear developers of the owncloud/android project, We are MSc students from the Delft University of Technology doing research on why builds break in open source projects. To do this, we are analyzing Travis build statistics and build history of owncloud/android. By analyzing the build history of owncloud/android, we found the following: The project has 16.1% failing builds in the history The project has a average amount of build failures compared to other similar projects When looking at owncloud/android’s build metrics, we could not find clear factors that are highly correlated with this result. To identify the reasons behind build breakage, we would like to collect developer insights into the reasons why build breakage occurs. If you have five minutes, please answer the survey we have created. Your response will be very useful in our study. Thank you.

report.summary: Android App successfully tests SSL connection but fails to log in 'Unknown error'
report.label: None yet
report.description:
Actual behaviour When trying to log in using the android application (version 2.7.0) entering https://cloud.chillstice.com yields the message: Secure connection established; however, when logging in with the correct credentials it tries to log in for 3 seconds and fails with the message: Unknown error. The desktop client works fine and the ownCloud panel accessible at cloud.chillstice.com works properly. Expected behaviour The application should log in like I was able to do many times before moving to a subdomain. Steps to reproduce Create a subdomain redirect to the directory ownCloud is installed in. Try to connect using the new address with the android application. Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) NO :C Environment data Android version: 7.0 Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7 Verizon (SM-G930V) Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.7.0 ownCloud server version: 10.0.7.2 Logs Web server error log No relevant errors ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log) No relevant errors More Info Today I finally figured out how to properly create subdomains and how to set ownCloud to be accessible under the 'cloud' subdomain. I changed the config.php to include the following: 'trusted_domains' => array ( 0 => 'chillstice.com', 1 => 'cloud.chillstice.com', ), 'overwrite.cli.url' => 'https://cloud.chillstice.com/', 'htaccess.RewriteBase' => '/',
Then I ran 'occ maintenance:update:htaccess' The SSL certificates for the subdomain have also successfully been updated and are live. I only started having this problem after setting up the subdomain.
